availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Faulconer (Harrison County KY, resident and student )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, resident and student. Kentucky native. Son of Edmund Faulconer and Elizabeth Hedger Faulconer. Resident of Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Student in Harrison County in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 135A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 529.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 116A.
James G. Faulconer, Thomas Faulconer and His Descendants, (Baltimore, MD: Gateway Press, Inc, 1984), 20-22.
